Reviews.Title: “Madrid's Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Caz25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right in the centre of Sol and less than a minute from the tube. I'm not a picky customer, but the hotel was not of 3 * standard at all; you may be better off in a hostel around the same area for a better price. The room was adequate, but rather small. The bathroom wasn't too pleasant - toilet seat had broken off and was just placed on top. The water was lukewarm and seemed to be yellowish. There was also no soap in the bathroom. When I asked for some at the foyer, I was told there was no soap and given a few sachets of shower gel. The staff are a bit of a mixed bunch. If you have the misfortune to be met by the older lady with spectacles be prepared to be totally ignored. The two younger girls on the desk in the evening are great - polite, friendly and very helpful. If you wanted a hot drink you could ask at reception and if you're lucky they will open up the restaurant to give you access to the coffee machine - they will charge 1 euro for a cup of tea/cofffee. Beware of the lift!! This is an extremely scary contraption. You can squeeze 2 of you in (very intimitely) and then stand back while trying to press the button. The doors didn't shut properly, and if you happen to stand near the edge you could probably get bits of yourself sliced off. It did remind me a little of staying in a real life 'Fawlty Towers' - the experience was not necessarily negative, but you really would expect better. If it weren't for the staff and lack of amenities this hotel could be very nice. The only real advantage of this hotel is its location. There are a number of hostels around the area, which I think I will look into if I go back to Madrid again. Whilst it was relatively cheap, I am sure you could still get more for your money in a nice hostel. This was a bit of a let-down.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wlmasters
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews I was a bit sceptical about staying here. I would say all my fears were unfounded. It is a budget hotel slap bang in the city centre, ideal for everything, Sure it can be noisy at night. but which capital city isn't. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb triple in great location”
Reviews.Author: markdevlin
Reviews.Content: We were staying for 5 nights so the very sizeable triple (with another bed) was great. Spotless roomy bathroom and plentiful breakfasts and friendly staff. The location wa superb and the noise was non-existent in our room. Would go there again gladly. MC

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: IantheWelsh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day trip to Madrid. Searched around for a convenient hotel which we could afford on a tight budget. Came across Hotel Madrid and was very satisfied with the result. Yes the hotel can be a bit noisy at night, yes the rooms are not to the high standard you'd expect in a 5* hotel. But this isn't a 5* hotel! I think this is what some of the previous reviews seem to forget! For the price I paid, I got exactly what I wanted - a fantastically located lodgings right in the heart of the capital. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, nice bathroom. I didn't have breakfast, so I can't comment on that. All in all, perfect for those travelling on the cheap. Book directly with the hotel (there's a website) and you'll get a cheaper rate than through an agency.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you know how to deal with the staff”
Reviews.Author: bryan77
Reviews.Content: I ahve stayed here a few times. My stays are usually very good and I have always had a room with an airconditioner. i was not aware that any non-airconditioned rooms exist. One time upon arrival they told us our room's AC was broken but they transfered us to their sister hotel about a mile away. Yes, some of the rooms can be noisy but you can request one not facing Calle Carretas. I usually book the web only rate for around 60-80 euros and feel that this is a very good deal due to the close proximity fo the metro at Sol and the many great bars and restaurants in the area behind the hotel around plaza Santa Ana and Calle Huertas.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although we enjoyed our stay in Madrid, this accomodation was disappointing. My sister & partners room was nice, but freezing cold and my room was dull, small & had a tiny window with an unpleasant view. We spent as little time as possible here. To add to it i was bitten about 15times which i can only imagine was from the bed. We did complain but no action was taken. You only get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent For The Money You Won't Find Better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2004, Superb location a stones throw from the Metro (and I mean that literally) and situated in the heart of Puerta Del Sol where all the nightlife and restaurants seem to be. I was a little put off by some of the reviews that mentioned the hotel was noisy but I can't say I noticed any problem in this respect and didn't affect me sleeping. Book this hotel through Best Western you won't get cheaper and you won't have to pay for it until the day you check out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeoM55
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Madrid. While the hotel was on the noisy side at night, it was quite understandable given the location. We found that putting up with the noise at night, was well worth the excellent location. It was within walking distance to all of the hot spots in Madrid. If you are thinking of taking the hop on/hop off buses, all three of the lines stop right on the corner of the hotel. The staff was very friendly. The hotel has a shuttle that's free of charge from the airport and only charges 5 Euro for the return. That's quite a good deal. The rooms were very clean and like I said, the location was great. I would definitely stay there again on our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, good value.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, good Value. I booked a single room, but the room I got was huge! With a tiny bed in the middle. So tiny, in fact that my feet dangled over the edge. And I'm only 5 foot 9! The bed was comfortable though and had cotton sheets, which was a relief. But the room was cold. The heating didn't work, and it was terrifically noisey, as the room was on the street side (with a balcony). The madrilenos party til the wee hours, and the taxi drivers lean on the horns alot! It was very clean though, and the bathroom was very luxurious and well equipped. Breakfast was nice. But the whole hotel has no ambience. Soul-less, I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only two good things about this hotel: 1) location, 2) breakfast. Having stayed in hotels all over the world, I must admit this was even worse than most $29.95/night motels. Extremely noisy, no air conditioning, no television. In my younger years, I stayed in youth hostels that were nicer. If you are willing to stay a few blocks outside of this area, then you will find luxury hotel accomodations for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_Wells
Reviews.Content: Miserable time at this hotel - no TV in room, when we complained they reluctantly brought one, but could not fix it to the wall bracket. We had to have it precariously balanced on top of a box and stool. No air conditioning, so had to have windows open - the noise from outside and from the lift shafts meant sleepless nights. They say they offer free beverages throughout the day and breakfast - this is not the case - they want payment for both. The airport shuttle bus does not run between 1pm and 4pm - we arrived at 1.45pm, so had to wait for hours at the airport. When I brought all of these failings to the attention of Brandi Johnston at Best Western International Customer Relations, he arranged that we could have a free weekend at this hotel to show that this was a one off. The hotel to date, have ignored all correspondence regarding the free weekend and Brandi Johnston says he can do nothing about it! If you are looking for a great hotel do not stay here! Madrid is a fantastic place to visit, so don't be put off - just choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View, but no Air Conditoner”
Reviews.Author: Cortlandt20
Reviews.Content: Upon seeing the great location posted by others, I thought this hotel would be a great deal. But unfortunately, I also received a room without an air conditioner and had to sleep with the windows open and try to sleep with the noise. Luckily I was able to change rooms to one with an air conditioner my second night. Unfortunately, though, when I returned that afternoon to change for dinner the maid had turned off the main switch to the room, so I had to get ready in unbearable heat. The night receptionist was also extremely rude and could not believe I did not want to keep my first room. Moreover, even though they advertise free breakfast, they told me I would have to pay $7 Euros. Maybe this place would be good in the winter time, but it is still plain and old. I try to be financially responsible, but my happiness is worth more.

Reviews.Title: “Location a plus, but noisy.....”
Reviews.Author: twofortravel
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Best Western Madrid. It is centrally located, but the rooms were very small and sparsely furnished. Unfortunately, our rooms faced the street and during the night we heard the early morning boisterous comments made by the passing drunks. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fab”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a fantastic few days in Madrid. Stayed at Hotel Madrid and I was a little unsure of what to expect when we booked the hotel. But to my amazement it was quite a great place to stay. The location was spot on we got around quite conveniently. The rooms were clean and well equipped. Our 2yr old son loved it. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly most of the staff spoke English and the ones who weren't so good made an effort to understand you. Just fantastic. We will definately stay there again and well recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a one-shot deal”
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nites at Best Western Madrid. On the plus side, yes, the location is excellent and very central to everything..our room was quite large and nice (a triple) and the people who work there are most helpful and pleasant. HOWEVER...the noise level was unbelievable. People came in (loudly) starting at 1 a.m. and this went on till 3-4 in the morning with shouts, pounding on doors, drunken laughter, and oh yes, wild liasons next door (also unbelievably loud...explain that one to your children) .and this went on every night we were there. I also found the breakfast not very good, especially compared to other hotels we stayed at. This is definitely my last visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, surprisingly quiet.”
Reviews.Author: MissPicante
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and thought the location was fantastic. The hotel is on a surprisingly quiet street for its central location. I suspect some of the desk help had limited English (I speak Spanish) but all were very helpful. Outstanding (included) breakfast with white tablecloths and a variety of fruits, meats, cheese, bread, and tea and coffee. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tmmsshep
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed there over Christmas vacation. We had two rooms. They were clean, but outdated. The staff were friendly, but their English was not very good for some. The breakfast was very good. It was continental but was abundant and very fresh and tasty. The best thing about the hotel was location. The Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor and Royal Palace are only within walking distance from the hotel. The metro is located minutes away. Plenty of restaurants near by. Madridians are late night people and enjoy partying.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a nice experience at this hotel. This place is all about location. Staying here puts you within easy walking distance of the Palace and the Prado Museum and also within steps of a metro station. The hotel itself is pretty old. The elevators are on the sketchy side, but everything was clean. There was an abundance of hot water in the outdated bathroom. The room was dark, but comfortable. Breakfast was free, but nothing extraordinary. Didn't have problems with noise at all. Some of the hotel staff spoke a little English but some didn't speak any. Overall a good experience. This hotel is ideal for the traveler who doesn't plan on spending much time in their room and wants to be in the heart of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western: Hotel Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good - well located just of the Puerta del Sol. It looks like its recently been refurbished: all the rooms were newly carpeted and the bathroom fittings brand new. We had a triple room and it was huge. The staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel its located on one side of the Famous Puerta del Sol, my problems began since I took a taxi, its in one way only street, when I got of the cab all people started getting upset.Old hotel and not enough space for luggage in elevators, the rooms are clean but very small, and you can hear everything, even when somebody is taking a shower in the next room. Or when somebody closes the door in the hall.It was a nightmare trying to sleep in this place.The staff in the breakfast room was nice.When I checked out I had to walk down the street to get a taxi, they didn't called one.
